original: Arhusiander, Anders Edvard Magnus, fd. kommunalborgmästare, Kungälv, f. 27/5/79 i Köping av kontr :prost Anders A. o. Emmy Björling. G. 11 m. Carin Lundström. — Stud:ex. 97, jur. fjil. .ex. 98, kronoilänsm :ex. 08». Stadsfiskal o. stadskamr. i Kungälv 08, kommunarborgmästare fr. 38 t. pens. Ordf. i barnav:nd, nykterh :nd, p^ens :nd, taxer :nd, is’ekr. h. istadsfullm., sekr. i fattigv :styr., tjg. sjömanshus-omb :man, ordf. i lok:styr. f. Gbgs hand :banks avd :kont. i Kungälv. RVO 44.
translated: Anders Edvard Magnus Arhusiander, former municipal chief executive officer, was born on May 27th, 1879 in Köping to the Reverend Anders A. and Emmy Björling. He married Carin Lundström and had 11 children. Arhusiander passed his secondary school leaving examination in 1897, his law degree in 1898, and his county government examination in 1908. He served as municipal prosecutor and city treasurer in Kungälv from 1908, and was promoted to municipal chief executive officer from 1938 until his retirement. He was also the chairman of the child welfare committee, sobriety committee, pension committee, assessment committee, and ice hockey club in the city council, secretary of the poorhouse board, and served as an active seafarers' home officer and chairman of the local board for Gothenburg’s Handelsbanken branch in Kungälv. He was awarded the Royal Royal Order of Vasa in 1944.
